summary: Email correspondence between FBI and US Attorney's Office regarding privilege review terms for Epstein evidence. The terms were provided by Epstein's attorneys before his suicide and are being used by a taint team to filter privileged material from evidence review.

persons.name: NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner
persons.context: Receives email about Epstein evidence privilege terms and indicates their network is back up to work on the review.

events.title: Email exchange about Epstein evidence privilege review
events.description: FBI contacts forensic examiner to check if privilege review terms for Epstein evidence were received and to coordinate access to evidence review tools.
personsInvolved: NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner

events.title: Privilege terms provided to taint team
events.description: US Attorney's Office sends privilege review terms to FBI that were received from Epstein's attorneys before his suicide.

keyFacts: Privilege review terms for Epstein evidence were provided by Epstein's attorneys before his suicide.
A taint team at SDNY has been running these terms to filter privileged material from evidence.
The FBI is coordinating with forensic examiners to run these terms and review evidence in Blacklight.
The document references ongoing evidence review processes in March 2020, months after Epstein's death.
